newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Cyprus trade deficit fell 7.8 pct in Q1.
newsitem.headline: Cyprus trade deficit fell 7.8 pct in Q1.

text.p: Cyprus's trade deficit fell 7.8 percent to 279.2 million pounds ($529 million) in the first quarter of 1997 compared to 303.1 million in the first quarter of 1996, the statistics department said on Monday.
Total imports declined 8.0 percent, to imports worth 423.1 million in the first quarter of the year compared to 459.9 million in January to March 1996, the department said.
Total exports also fell 8.2 percent to 143.9 million compared with exports worth 156.8 million in Jan-March 1996.

European Union countries supplied goods valued at 204.1 million pounds, or 48.2 percent of total imports in the first quarter, compared with 47.2 percent of imports in the first quarter of 1996 valued at 217 million pounds.
Countries in the European Union absorbed 55.6 percent of Cyprus's domestic exports followed by Arab countries with a 22.2 percent share in the first quarter of this year. ($=0.527 pound)
